Lisa Courtney Simpson and James Nicholas Hayes were married on Friday in Hamilton, Bermuda. The Rev. James W. Francis, an Anglican priest, performed the ceremony at Waterloo House, a hotel.

Mr. and Mrs. Hayes work for government affairs consulting firms. She is the chief administrative officer in the Washington office of Clark & Weinstock; he is a lobbyist with I. C. G. Consulting in Rectortown, Va.

The bride graduated from Trinity College in Washington and received a master's degree in journalism and public affairs from American University. She is a daughter of Marjorie Casey Sweitzer of Germantown, Md., and Henry Becker Sweitzer of Shillington, Pa. Her father, a former Navy captain, retired as the administrative assistant to former Representative Thomas Bevell of Alabama.

The bridegroom, who is known as Nick, was from 1982 to 1995 the chief of staff to the late Representative Hamilton Fish Jr., who represented the 19th Congressional District of New York. The bridegroom is also the owner of the Hurley-Johnson Corporation, an importer and exporter of printing equipment, formerly in New York and now in Marshall, Va. He graduated from Trinity College in Hartford. He is a son of the late Josephine and John A. Hayes Jr., who lived in New York. His father was a partner in Menken, Ferguson, Idler & Hayes, a former New York law firm.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.
